definition: easy to grasp but difficult to put into practice (idiom)/easier said than done
easy/amiable/to change/to exchange/prefix corresponding to the English adjective suffix "-able" or "-ible"
surname Yi/abbr. for 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], the Book of Changes
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense

sentences.english: That's easier said than done, of course.
Everything is easier said than done.
The above-mentioned reason is very simple, but easier said than done.
sentences.chinese: 上述道理非常淺顯，但是知易行難。

sentences.chinese: 對我而言，最新的教訓就是知易行難。

sentences.english: The management is creative, and know the easy line difficult. the success must set up.
sentences.chinese: 管理創新，知易行難，成功必須創新。

definition: lit. to assess the head and discuss the feet (idiom); minute criticism of a woman's appearance/fig. to find fault in minor details/nitpicking/overcritical
toss a peach, get back a plum (idiom); to return a favor/to exchange gifts/Scratch my back, and I'll scratch yours.
lit. neither a relative nor a friend (idiom)/fig. unrelated to one another in any way
to heave a sigh of relief
lit. drinking poison in the hope of quenching one's thirst (idiom)/fig. a supposed remedy that only makes matters worse
lit. Lord Ye's passion for dragons (idiom)/fig. to pretend to be fond of sth while actually fearing it/ostensible fondness of sth one really fears
